title: Inside the Dreamliner flight that broke records after nearly 20 hours in the air
text:
Qantas' Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner made aviation history as it flew direct from New York to Sydney

Qantas made aviation history this week as it operated the world's longest Dreamliner flight.

The Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner flew direct from New York to Sydney, making the journey in 19 hours and 16 minutes.

The aircraft had just 49 passengers and crew on board, including four pilots who operated the service.

The route is actually a test flight as the airline looks to launch more regular direct routes from Australia to London and New York. It's currently not confirmed if the services will go ahead, although a decision is expected by the end of the year.

In the meantime, we take a look inside the historic flight from the aircraft itself to the meals which passengers enjoyed during the journey...
description: Qantas' Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner made aviation history as it flew direct from New York to Sydney
